column4: What "desktop environment" does Ubuntu 11.10 use by default, Unity, correct?
the DE is gnome
unity is only a shell
So, all of gnome services such as the gnome-settings-daemon are running? Or are you just calling it gnome 'cause gtk is used by many apps?
no, it is Gnome
And Unity is the composite manager / window-manager / other things a window manager or composite manager should never do such as draw a "dock" and is therefore a "shell". Ah, I see.
you don't have to use unity. Install xfce4 and your OS will look and feel like Gnome2

Yeah, no, I know that I don't. The problem is that other people installed Ubuntu without knowing that they signed up for a beta-test program. They'd probably be better of with CentOS 6.2 for their particular use case.
its stable..
That's what they said about Gnome 3 =\
you don't have to use Gnome3
Calling Ubuntu stable, is like calling an Android ROM that doesn't support Wifi or Bluetooth "stable".

I know I don't have to use Gnome 3, and I don't. The problem is that this computer illiterate acquaintance of mine installed Ubuntu 11.10 without it being made clear to her that she was signing up for a voluntary beta-testing program (which is basically what Ubuntu is, because you put incomplete projects like Gnome 3 in there).
just because an android rom doesn't have certain features doesn't mean it won't crash more
maybe you should have researched...
in short, if you don't like it, change it. Its that simple
I'm not the one who suggested Ubuntu to her. I'll be suggesting CentOS 6.2 to her.
why do we need to know this?
I don't like it and I won't change it - there are healthier eco-systems than Ubuntu.
why are you telling us all this. This is a support channel, no a 'vent your opinions' channel
as long as its suport based its fine, if you want chit chat then #ubuntu-offtopic is the right place
I will talk about Ubuntu - which is on topic.
no, support is the one and only topic
as I said.
